intro: Disticholiparis disticha, commonly known as the two-ranked lily, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its unique leaf arrangement, with leaves arranged in two distinct ranks, giving it a striking visual appearance. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with six petals arranged symmetrically. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
